fuzzing_params.Constraints: 1 <= side <= 10^9, 4 <= points.length <= min(4 * side, 15 * 10^3), points[i] == [xi, yi]. The input is generated such that: points[i] lies on the boundary of the square. All points[i] are unique. 4 <= k <= min(25, points.length)

problem_info.title: 3464. Maximize the Distance Between Points on a Square
test_examples: Example 1: Input: side = 2, points = [[0,2],[2,0],[2,2],[0,0]], k = 4 Output: 2 Explanation: Select all four points.
Example 2: Input: side = 2, points = [[0,0],[1,2],[2,0],[2,2],[2,1]], k = 4 Output: 1 Explanation: Select the points (0, 0), (2, 0), (2, 2), and (2, 1).
Example 3: Input: side = 2, points = [[0,0],[0,1],[0,2],[1,2],[2,0],[2,2],[2,1]], k = 5 Output: 1 Explanation: Select the points (0, 0), (0, 1), (0, 2), (1, 2), and (2, 2).
